Son Of Sardar! Diljit Dosanjh Shares The Advice He Got Before Becoming A Bollywood Actor
Son Of Sardar! Diljit Dosanjh Shares The Advice He Got Before Becoming A Bollywood Actor
In an industry, which is driven more by the popularity of an actor rather than his/her skills – where good looks matter more than the actual acting prowess – and where nepotism is a never-ending debate that the entire film fraternity either disses or avoids the topic, do you even think it is easier to even aspire to become an actor?
Without good looks and great physique, even the most remarkable actors have to struggle before landing the lead role in a film.
4.bp.blogspot.com
Now just imagine how difficult it is for a Sikh actor to make way in such an industry.
Having bagged prominent roles in Bollywood films, Diljit Dosanjh has carved his own path in the industry and how! He is one of the only few actors who has successfully represented Sikh community in the mainstream Hindi cinema.
mahapunjab.com

“Sardar actors can't be successful in Hindi cinema,” that’s what Diljit Dosanjh used to think before venturing into the world of films. Not only did he change that for himself but for others too.
bollywoodmdb.com
“Actually a lot of people have told me that I shouldn't be an actor. People told me to get rid of my turban or not become an actor. Back then, I knew that I would be okay to give up films, but not my turban,” he told IANS.
Wallpapers Den
With films such as Udta Punjab, Phillauri and Soorma, Diljit Dosanjh has not only proved his mettle as an actor but also his versatility.
“An actor is more than his ethnicity and his religion. A filmmaker, a director has to be convinced and should be able to envision someone in a role, regardless of Sikh or not Sikh, if the filmmaker feels you suit the role, then that's perfect," he says.
